sentence.Network_en: Grace allowed her mind to wander to other things.
sentence.Network_cn: 格雷丝任由自己的思绪游走。

phrase.cizu_name: be in someone's good (或 bad) graces

jx.jx_en_mean: be regarded by someone with favour (or disfavour)

phrase.cizu_name: there but for the grace of God (go I)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to acknowledge one's good fortune in avoiding another's mistake or misfortune
jx.jx_cn_mean: 天助我也（用来承认运气好，没有犯和别人一样的错误或遭遇同样的不幸）

jx.jx_en_mean: (Greek Mythology)three beautiful goddesses （Aglaia, Thalia, and Euphrosyne）, daughters of Zeus. They were believed to personify and bestow charm, grace, and beauty
jx.jx_cn_mean: (希腊神话)美慧三女神（阿格拉伊亚、塔利亚和欧佛洛绪涅，宙斯之女，她们被认为代表并可以给予魅力、优雅和美丽）

jx.jx_en_mean: in a willing and happy (or resentful and reluctant) manner
jx.jx_cn_mean: 乐意地，欣然地（或憎恨地，勉强地）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin gratia, from gratus 'pleasing, thankful'; related to grateful

entry.def: If someone moves with grace, they move in a smooth, controlled, and attractive way.

example.ex: He moved with the grace of a trained boxer...
example.tran: 他的动作带着一种训练有素的拳击手的风采。

example.ex: Ballet classes are important for poise and grace.
example.tran: 芭蕾课可以很好地使人保持优雅的仪态。

entry.def: If someone behaves with grace, they behave in a pleasant, polite, and dignified way, even when they are upset or being treated unfairly.

example.ex: The new King seemed to be carrying out his duties with grace and due decorum...
example.tran: 新国王在履行职责时看起来举止得体、端庄稳重。

example.ex: The young woman had grace beyond her years.
example.tran: 这个年轻女子有着超越年龄的涵养。

entry.def: The graces are the ways of behaving and doing things which are considered polite and well-mannered.

example.ex: She didn't fit in and she had few social graces.
example.tran: 她不适合这种场合，对社交礼仪所知甚少。

entry.def: Grace is used in expressions such as a day's  grace and a month's grace to say that you are allowed that amount of extra time before you have to finish something.

example.ex: She wanted a couple of days' grace to get the maisonette cleaned before she moved in...
example.tran: 她想延缓几天，等到把这套复式公寓清理干净后再搬进去。

example.ex: We have only a few hours' grace before the soldiers come.
example.tran: 士兵到来之前我们只剩下几个小时了。

entry.def: If you say that something graces a place or a person, you mean that it makes them more attractive.

example.ex: He went to the beautiful old Welsh dresser that graced this homely room...
example.tran: 他走到为这间舒适的房间增色不少的漂亮的旧威尔士碗橱前。

example.ex: Her shoulders were graced with mink and her fingers sparkled with diamonds.
example.tran: 肩上披着的貂皮衬托得她更加优雅，手上的钻戒则光彩夺目。

entry.def: If you say that someone important will grace an event or an organization, you mean that they have agreed to be present at the event or to be part of the organization.

example.ex: He had been invited to grace a function at the evening college.
example.tran: 他应邀为这所夜校的活动捧场。

entry.def: In Christianity and some other religions, grace is the kindness that God shows to people because he loves them.

example.ex: It was only by the grace of God that no one died.
example.tran: 承蒙上帝保佑才无人死亡。

entry.def: When someone says grace before or after a meal, they say a prayer in which they thank God for the food and ask Him to bless it.

example.ex: Leo, will you say grace?
example.tran: 利奥，你来做饭前祷告吧？

example.ex: ...a Latin grace.
example.tran: 拉丁文的谢恩祷告

entry.tran: （对公爵、公爵夫人或大主教的尊称）大人，阁下，夫人
entry.def: You use expressions such as Your Grace and His Grace when you are addressing or referring to a duke, duchess, or archbishop.

example.ex: Your Grace, I have a great favour to ask of you.
example.tran: 大人，我想请您施以大惠。

entry.def: If someone falls from grace, they suddenly stop being successful or popular.

example.ex: All went well at first, and I was in high favour; but presently I fell from grace...
example.tran: 我最初一帆风顺，备受器重，但现在却失宠了。

entry.tran: 通情达理地做;知趣地做
entry.def: If someone has the good grace to do something, they are polite enough or honest enough to do it.

example.ex: He did not even have the grace to apologise...
example.tran: 他甚至连一个道歉都没有。

example.ex: Many of us do stupid things in our youth, but we should have the good grace to admit them.
example.tran: 我们很多人在年轻的时候都会干些糊涂事，但是，我们应该懂得承认错误。

entry.tran: 若非上帝保佑，要不是我福大命大（我也会遭此不幸）
entry.def: If you are talking about someone who is in a bad situation and you say 'There but for the grace of God go I', you mean that you are lucky not to be in the same situation as them and you feel sympathy for them.

entry.tran: 情愿地/ 不情愿地；欣然地/不乐意地
entry.def: If you do something unpleasant with good grace or with a good grace, you do it cheerfully and without complaining. If you do something with bad grace or with a bad grace, you do it unwillingly and without enthusiasm.

example.ex: He accepted the decision with good grace, and wished me the very best of luck...
example.tran: 他欣然接受这一决定并祝我好运。

example.ex: With appallingly bad grace I packed up and we drove north.
example.tran: 我很不情愿地收拾好行囊，然后我们驱车向北开去。

entry.def: If you are in someone's good graces, they are pleased with you.

example.ex: You're so eager to stay in the good graces of the King that nothing else matters to you.
example.tran: 你如此急于博得国王的欢心，以致其他事情都不管不顾了。

means.word_mean: 1. (Bhristian theology) a state of sanctification by God; the state of one who under such divine influence;

sentences.sentence: "the conception of grace developed alongside the conception of sin"
"it was debated whether saving grace could be obtained outside the membership of the church"
"the Virgin lived in a state of grace"

means.word_mean: 2. elegance and beauty of movement or expression
3. a sense of propriety and consideration for others
4. a disposition to kindness and compassion; benign good will;

sentences.sentence: "the victor's grace in treating the vanquished"

means.word_mean: 5. a short prayer of thanks before a meal
6. (Christian theology) the free and unmerited favor or beneficence of God;

sentences.sentence: "God's grace is manifested in the salvation of sinners"
"there but for the grace of God go I"

means.word_mean: 1. make more attractive by adding ornament, colour, etc.;

auth_sentence.content: He has demonstrated sound judgment and grace under pressure.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has demonstrated sound judgment and grace under pressure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has demonstrated sound judgment and grace under pressure.

auth_sentence.content: But there is also grace, kindness and altruism.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there is also grace, kindness and altruism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But there is also grace, kindness and altruism.

auth_sentence.content: There were limits to his grace, after all.
auth_sentence.res_content: There were limits to his grace, after all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There were limits to his grace, after all.

stems_affixes.word_buile: grate=grat感激,高兴+ful充满……的→adj.[to,for]感激的;感谢的
gratuity[[n.赏钱,小费]]涔吹腫给小费可多可少]→所以"无缘无故"的
ingratiate[v.逢迎,讨好]+ing……的→adj.讨好的,谄媚的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优美,文雅;恩惠,恩泽;宽限,缓刑;感恩祷告
stems_affixes.word_buile: grace=grat感激,高兴→感激别人态度一定好,所以grace有了"文雅"的意义
grat感激,高兴+itude状态→n.感激,感谢
grat感激,高兴+uity=ity表名词→因感激而给小钱,小费
in不+grat感激,高兴+e→不感谢→忘恩负义

stems_affixes.value_cn: 祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+gratulate[v.欢迎, 祝]→v.祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
grat感激,高兴+ify使……→使[人]满足,高兴
grat感激,高兴+ulate→让[别人]高兴→祝贺
in使……+grat感激,高兴+iate表动词→使别人高兴→讨好

Sentence.sentence: His fall from grace in the 1980s, followed by his return to Apple in 1996 after a period in the wilderness, is an inspiration to any businessperson whose career has taken a turn for the worse.
Grace Kao, a professor at Penn said she was not surprised by the findings.
What does Grace Kao say about interracial lodging?

sentences.en: The gymnast performed on the balance beam with an easy grace.
sentences.cn: 体操运动员在平衡木上表演得优美自如。

sentences.en: A young man with graces appeared on the stage.
sentences.cn: 舞台上出现了一位风度翩翩的年轻人。

sentences.en: Payment is due today, but I gave her a week's grace.
sentences.cn: 今天付款到期, 但我给了她一个星期的宽限。

means.word_mean: 恩泽, 善意，恩宠，恩典

sentences.en: He had been the king's favourite, and his sudden fall from grace surprised everyone.
sentences.cn: 他本是国王的宠臣, 一朝失宠众人都感到意外。

means.word_mean: 修饰或装扮，为增色，为锦上添花

sentences.en: Fine paintings graced the walls of the room.
sentences.cn: 这些精美的绘画使四壁生辉。

jushi.english: He had been the king's favorite, and his sudden fall from grace surprised everyone.
jushi.chinese: 他本是国王的宠臣,一朝失宠众人都感到意外。

jushi.english: Payment is due today, but I gave her a week's grace.
jushi.chinese: 今天付款到期,但我给了她一个星期的宽限。

jushi.english: A young man with graces appeared on the stage.
jushi.chinese: 舞台上出现了一位风度翩翩的年轻人。
